Home → Events and activities → Film screening: Life on the Deben - SOLD OUT

Film screening: Life on the Deben - SOLD OUT

  • Debenham Library

  • Fri 23 Feb, 2018
  • 1930 –
  • Doors open 1900

  • Tickets: £ Sold out!

This event is now sold out, but there are still tickets for Life on the Deben at Debenham Library on Saturday 24 February

The major new documentary Life on the Deben follows the River Deben from Debenham at the boatyards and bustle of Woodbridge down to the sea at Bawdsey and Felixstowe Ferry.

Produced in association with the Woodbridge Riverside Trust, the film is written and presented by John McCarthy and produced by Malcolm Hodd. It takes a journey into the Debenâ€™s rich past, looking at its geography, environment and the influence the river has had over the people who have lived by its banks.

The film features wildlife and conservation along the river and looks at daily life past and present, including boat building, sailing, farming, fishing, milling and even smuggling.
